alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 13 at 6:59PM CDT until July 14 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT THURSDAY FOR CENTRAL WAYNE COUNTY... At 659 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorms producing torrential rainfall were gradually weakening and pushing into southern Wayne county. Wayne County Emergency Management officials reported flash flooding on several streets in the community of Waynesboro at 615 PM CDT. Excessive runoff from earlier torrential downpours will continue to result in flash flooding along some streets, creeks and streams, and other low lying areas. Never attempt to cross a flooded roadway. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Waynesboro, West King, Woodwards, Boice, Hiwannee, Whistler, Winchester, Denham, Gretna and Eucutta. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
